topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5557227c63687212909f0000#post_5557227c63687212909f0000
Interesting. But I very much doubt that most of what you said is the actual reason behind the dream.

1. The lumps weren't like any real-life disease. Think of two ping-pong balls at the base of your neck, at the front, under the skin. That was what it was like. I honestly don't think I've ever been bitten by a mosquito; one tried once, but I felt it poking me and flicked it away before it actually penetrated my skin. And that was _years_ ago.

2. As for the blood, I didn't know anything about those kind of rituals, even that they existed, so the dream couldn't possibly have been based on them. However... now that I think about it, the blood tasted like "blood orange":http://www.tarasmulticulturaltable.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/02/blood-orange-1-of-1.jpg juice, not medicine - and I had been thinking about blood oranges a day or two ago. My brain must have just made the connection.

3. As for the dragoness, well... you're right there. It wouldn't take Einstein to figure that one out.
topics.author: 52f5159b6368721440260300

topics.body:
"@BrownieComicWriter":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/555736e0636872358d6b2300#post_555736e0636872358d6b2300
What he said holds true. You cannot dream of anything you know not of. Hence why the myth that dreams can predict events is utter rubbish.

topics.body:
"@BrownieComicWriter":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/555736e0636872358d6b2300#post_555736e0636872358d6b2300
Awesome.
I had blood oranges once. Not really a fan of it though.

Also, the ping pong balls part. Wouldn't that just be the _laryngeal prominence_ (AKA "Adam's Apple") only larger in your dream? Try touching your throat. You'll feel it.










Also again, *WHAT KIND OF SKIN DO YOU HAVE?!*

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/555738f36368724fc17e0d00#post_555738f36368724fc17e0d00
What? Is your Adam's Apple two large spherical lumps? Mine certainly isn't.

[bq]"@BrownieComicWriter":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/555736e0636872358d6b2300#post_555736e0636872358d6b2300
*WHAT KIND OF SKIN DO YOU HAVE?!*[/bq]
Are you asking me how the mosquito failed to successfully bite me? Well, I dunno. Maybe it just messed it up. Also, I noticed it straight away, because it was on my hand. Not a sensible place to jab sharp objects into someone and hope they won't notice.

I tried blood oranges too. I thought they were too sour, like in the dream.
